page.title: 09Morwenstow Historic Houses
page.content: Almost any house of appreciable age in the area has claims to being historic. They range from traditional thatched cob to medieval manor house. Coombe valley contains the remains of a village with mill and a handful of cottages all thatched. On the opposite hill is Stowe Barton the ancient home of the Grenvilles of naval and civil war fame. The present house was once the stables of a greater dwelling. Lee Barton mentioned in the original Domesday survives as a working farm. Stanbury manor celebrated its 400th anniversary of rebuilding this year. Here also are Ham with its nearby mill and Eastaway on the site of a former manor. Woodford has old cottages; Ovis pictured with Stowe in 1680, still exists; Harscott adjacent to CSOS is now in ruins. All these are private houses unavailable to the public.
